column4: im at the point where im just going to stick with fedora since i dont have the error with it.
I wouldn't blame you.  I don't see this as an easy thing to track down.  You could try a different ubuntu version too and see if that works out better
I think i will take that course of action. My hardware just has problems with linux.
when i upgrade i will probably try ubuntu again. This system is about 5 years old now anyway. Thanks for your time.
